H0.text: Crystallized into natural glass is the process by which sedimentary rock forms in the rock cycle.

H1.text: Exposed to great temperature is the condition under which rock forms sedimentary rock in the rock cycle.

H2.text: Melted into liquid magma is the process by which rock forms sedimentary rock in the rock cycle.

H3.text: Broken down by weathering is the process that causes sedimentary rock to form in the rock cycle.

A6.text: Geological detritus originates from weathering and erosion of existing rocks
